intro: Solenanthus strictissimus, commonly known as the narrowleaf solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in open, sunny habitats and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution. Solenanthus strictissimus plays a role in supporting local insect populations and contributes to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
